Review text:
I keep them set on "mode 2" which is dim all night until motion where they get bright for like 20-30 seconds until the motion is gone.  

The motion sensing works good.  

These are mainly to keep track of our dogs at night as our yard is very large.  

We have enough motion lights on the perimeter to locate them as they walk/run by.  

The batteries on these lights last a long time and they last from dusk to dawn in "mode 2".  

The remote has a very limited range, however.

Review text: "This thing, at first glance, is terrific!  It provides all of the features Id been looking for.  Great mountability, ease if use, several settings, even a really handy remote.  I cannot believe how easy these things are to mount, and the cord allows you the distance to put them just about anywhere... If you like, you can actually also get an extension cord online here at Amazon, to put them even further away--believe it or not!  So impressed was I, that Ive purchased seven of these around my home, which now looks to be more of a night-light action fortress... Thanks to these lights.  When my wife and I take our puppy out, the moment we open the door... Each of these, motion-sensor set, progressively lights our way... Joy, our puppy, can see with perfect clarity, and I never flip a switch (until around midnight).  In the front of our home, I know (until around midnight) if someone is lurking anywhere near our front window or either of the gated areas.  And importantly, any prowler knows that I know--Instantly.  Again, please note... Until about midnight.  Because, these things have about a 3 hour life... Provided theyre on setting number 3 (nightlight until set off by motion sensor). Perfect, absolute perfection, if youre looking for a fraction of your nights lighting and protection.", "This battery life thing was so completely not well thought out, and there is no way, according to customer service, to update the internal battery.  ABSOLUTELY ridiculous.  Now, please understand, there are batteries out there that would make these things completely and marvelously functional.  But, you cannot access the battery in these to change them to make them longer-lasting.  Ive asked, Ive tried... Ive done so with the other products that Ive bought through other manufacturers.  The other products have worked absolutely perfectly with this simple upgrade.  And folks, winter is coming, temperatures are dropping, day light will be lessening.  That means these lights, will only function for maybe, two hours?", "So, in my opinion, that makes this product completely not useful.  In-fact, all-but useless.  All, and I mean ALL that I have purchased will be going back, and I will begin the process all over again with another brand that does the same exact thing... Just has far more sustainably and has thought this through.  All this company had to do was to allow access to change the battery, and that wouldve worked.  Nope!", Well, buyer beware... Review text:
These lights were easy to set up.

They turn on when the sun goes down, and they turn off when the sun comes up.

The brightness level, by default, is set to a lower level to conserve battery life, and it shines at full brightness whenever the motion sensor detects movement.

It comes with remotes, but I never use them.

Good value for the asking price.
